io.sarl.core

Interface SREBootstrap

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Bootstrap

    public interface SREBootstrap
    Represents an access point to the SARL run-time environment (SRE). This access point may be used for accessing the underlying SRE independently of its implementation.

    Depending on the implementation of the SRE, an instance of this SRE access point could be injected.

    Since:
    0.6
    Version:
    0.7.0-SNAPSHOT 2017-10-02 00:10:00
    Author:
    Stéphane Galland
    Maven Group Id:
    io.sarl
    Maven Artifact Id:
    io.sarl.core

    • Method Detail

      • startWithoutAgent

        def startWithoutAgent() : AgentContext 
        Start the SRE without an agent. This function prepare the default context.
        Returns:
        the context that is created by the bootstrap. If null there is no context created.
        Since:
        0.7

      • startAgent

        def startAgent(agentCls : Class<? extends Agent>,
               params : Object*) : UUID 
        throws Exception
        Launch the SRE and the first agent in the kernel.

        The function getBootAgentIdentifier() permits to retrieve the identifier of the launched agent.

        Parameters:
        agentCls - type of the first agent to launch.
        params - parameters to pass to the agent as its initialization parameters.
        Returns:
        the identifier of the created agent.
        Throws:
        Exception - - if it is impossible to start the platform.
        See Also:
        getBootAgentIdentifier()

      • startAgent

        def startAgent(nbAgents : int,
               agentCls : Class<? extends Agent>,
               params : Object*) : Iterable<UUID> 
        throws Exception
        Launch the SRE and the first agent in the kernel.

        The function getBootAgentIdentifier() permits to retrieve the identifier of the launched agent.

        Parameters:
        nbAgents - the number of agents to be launched.
        agentCls - type of the first agent to launch.
        params - parameters to pass to the agent as its initialization parameters.
        Returns:
        the identifiers of the created agents.
        Throws:
        Exception - - if it is impossible to start the platform.
        See Also:
        getBootAgentIdentifier()

      • getBootAgentIdentifier

        def getBootAgentIdentifier() : UUID 
        Replies the identifier of the boot agent from the system's properties. The boot agent is launched with startAgent(int, Class, Object...).
        Returns:
        the identifier of the boot agent, or null if it is unknown.
        See Also:
        startAgent(int, Class, Object...)

      • isActive

        @Pure
default def isActive() : boolean 
        Replies if the bootstrap could be used.

        If the bootstrap cannot be used, it cannot launch agent.

        Returns:
        true if the bootstrap could be used. false if it cannot be used.
